articles.title: Watkins Advises Safehold in US$300 Million Notes Offering
articles.summary: Latham & Watkins advised Safehold Inc. on its operating company's public offering of US$300 million aggregate principal amount of 6.100% senior notes due 2034. The offering closed on March 4, 2024, with the notes fully and unconditionally guaranteed by Safehold Inc.

articles.title: Capital One’s Discover Acquisition Would Reshape US Credit Card Industry
articles.summary: Capital One plans to acquire Discover Financial Services in an all-stock transaction valued at $35.3 billion, a move that would significantly reshape the US credit card industry. The deal faces intense scrutiny from antitrust authorities and politicians concerned about market consolidation. If approved, the merger would create a credit card giant, with Capital One shareholders owning 60% of the combined entity.

articles.title: Exclusive: UK regulators lift punitive capital demands on Nomura, sources say
articles.summary: UK regulators have lifted punitive capital demands on Nomura Holdings Inc. that were imposed after the company lost $2.9 billion on fund Archegos. This decision by the Prudential Regulation Authority frees Nomura's European unit from a measure that curbed risk-taking and allows it to invest the additional capital in its wholesale business in Europe, following progress on a remediation plan to improve risk monitoring and control systems. The Japanese brokerage has been working with McKinsey since 2021 to strengthen its risk management and has seen its share price rise by 34% this year.

articles.title: Wells Fargo appoints JPMorgan veteran as vice chairman
articles.summary: Wells Fargo has appointed Doug Braunstein, a former chief financial officer at JPMorgan Chase & Co., as its new vice chairman. In this role, Braunstein will focus on expanding the bank's corporate finance and advisory businesses and advising senior management. This appointment follows Tom Nides' short tenure in the same position, as Wells Fargo continues its strategy to strengthen its corporate and investment banking division.

articles.title: Ropes & Gray Advises Underwriters in TPG Secondary Public Offering
articles.summary: Ropes & Gray advised J.P. Morgan and Morgan Stanley as underwriters in TPG Inc.'s secondary public offering of Class A common stock. Certain TPG stockholders plan to offer over 15.5 million shares pursuant to a shelf registration statement. TPG is a global alternative asset management firm with $222 billion in assets under management.

articles.title: Bitwise stacks up with the biggest players in bitcoin ETF race
articles.summary: Bitwise Asset Management is making significant strides in the bitcoin ETF market, positioning itself as a strong competitor against larger firms despite being a smaller player. Its BITB fund, launched recently, is effectively attracting crypto-native and serious investors due to its low cost, efficiency, and transparency with published wallet addresses. The company's consistent messaging and early engagement with regulators have contributed to its increasing adoption by RIA networks and other institutional investors.

articles.title: WealthStack Roundup: SEI Makes $10M Investment In TIFIN
articles.summary: SEI has made a strategic investment in AI developer and startup incubator TIFIN, aiming to foster rapid iteration of new ideas and gain access to TIFIN's AI technology. Additionally, Advyzon and Apex have announced new custody and integration features, streamlining processes for advisors. AssetMark plans to increase its technology budget to $60 million in 2024, reflecting its commitment to technological advancement despite rumors regarding a potential sale of its majority shareholder.

articles.title: Capital One's Takeover of Discover: All you Need to Know
articles.summary: Capital One has proposed a US$35.3bn acquisition of Discover Financial, aiming to create a globally competitive payments network and strengthen its position in the credit card market. While Capital One anticipates completion by early 2025, the deal faces regulatory scrutiny and opposition due to concerns over competition and consumer impact. S&P Global Ratings has affirmed Capital One's credit ratings but placed Discover's on CreditWatch with positive implications pending the acquisition.

articles.title: Exclusive: Occidental explores $20 bln-plus sale of Western Midstream, sources say
articles.summary: Occidental Petroleum is reportedly exploring the sale of Western Midstream Partners, a natural gas pipeline operator with a market value of nearly $20 billion including debt. This divestment would help Occidental reduce its substantial debt, which has grown due to recent acquisitions. Potential buyers include major energy infrastructure companies and private equity firms.

articles.title: Capital One to pay $35B for Discover in 2024's largest deal so far
articles.summary: Capital One has agreed to acquire Discover Financial Services in a $35 billion all-stock deal, creating the largest U.S. credit card company by loan volume. This acquisition, the largest global merger of 2024, will also provide Capital One with its own payment network, reducing reliance on Visa and Mastercard. The deal is expected to close in late 2024 or early 2025, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

articles.title: Capital One to acquire Discover in $35.3B deal
articles.summary: Capital One is set to acquire Discover in a $35.3 billion all-stock deal, aiming to significantly boost its credit card presence and create a combined entity with a 19% share of the revolving consumer loan market. The acquisition is expected to stabilize Discover after a challenging 2023 and reduce Capital One's reliance on Visa and Mastercard. However, the deal faces potential scrutiny from regulators concerned about market competition and benefits to the public.

articles.title: Capital One to buy Discover, forming nation’s biggest credit card company
articles.summary: Capital One has agreed to acquire Discover Financial Services in a $35-billion all-stock deal, creating the largest U.S. credit card company by loan volume. The transaction involves Capital One paying a 26.6% premium for each Discover share, and is expected to close in late 2024 or early 2025. This acquisition will generate significant pretax synergies and follows Discover's recent struggles with compliance lapses and a decline in profit.

articles.title: Latin America's largest lender Itau eyes a share of India's banking pie
articles.summary: Itaú Unibanco Holding SA, Latin America's largest lender, is reportedly exploring opening a branch in India, with representatives holding preliminary talks with government officials. This move aligns with increased trade between India and Brazil and potential opportunities in India's growing trade finance market. Approval for Itau's entry may be linked to Brazil allowing an Indian bank to operate there, with State Bank of India currently having only a representative office in Brazil.

articles.title: Metropolitan Commercial Bank Bolsters Risk Management and Finance Teams with Experienced Large Bank Veterans
articles.summary: Metropolitan Commercial Bank (MCB) has announced the appointment of three experienced veterans from large financial institutions to its risk management and finance teams: Gregory Gaare as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer, Theodore George Andreades as Senior Vice President and Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering Officer, and John M. McCaffery as Senior Vice President and Treasurer. These strategic hires aim to strengthen the Bank's regulatory compliance, risk management, and financial operations as it pursues expansion. The new appointees bring decades of expertise from notable financial institutions, reinforcing MCB's commitment to robust frameworks.

articles.title: With hopes for control shares fading, CEFs eye poison pill strategies
articles.summary: Closed-end funds (CEFs) are exploring new activist defense strategies like "poison pill" shareholder rights plans, following recent court rulings that invalidated control-share tactics. These plans, while potentially effective in deterring hostile takeovers, are likely to face legal challenges from activist investors, with experts divided on their compliance with the Investment Company Act of 1940. Funds are also considering other defensive measures, including enhanced shareholder analytics and stricter bylaw provisions, though changing domicile to Delaware for control shares remains a risky option.

articles.title: TEMIT vs JPMorgan: Which emerging market trust is best?
articles.summary: This article compares two major emerging market investment trusts, Templeton Emerging Markets (TEMIT) and JPMorgan Emerging Markets, to determine which is better for investors. It discusses their investment styles, geographical biases, performance, and costs, with experts offering their picks and suggestions for complementary holdings.

articles.title: Bank of America to invest $47M in Philadelphia-area retail network, open five new branches
articles.summary: Bank of America plans to invest $47 million over the next two years to enhance its retail network in the Philadelphia area. This investment will include opening five new branches and renovating all existing locations. The move reflects an ongoing trend of banks expanding their physical presence in key markets.

articles.title: Why Allocators Do Badly When Selling Stocks | Chief Investment Officer
articles.summary: Institutional investors consistently underperform in selling assets compared to buying them, leading to lower returns. A study by Cabot found that while buying is often well-researched, selling practices lack similar discipline, costing portfolios valuable alpha. Improving selling strategies is crucial, especially as passive investments continue to outperform active management.

articles.title: Lloyds Takes £450 Million Provision for Car Finance Review
articles.summary: Lloyds Banking Group Plc has set aside £450 million ($570 million) to cover potential compensation and costs related to a car finance review by UK regulators, making it the first major bank to quantify such charges. Alongside this provision, the bank announced plans for a £2 billion share buyback and an increased dividend following better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings. Lloyds' shares saw a significant rebound, trading 6.3% higher after the announcements.

articles.title: Reddit Files Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering
articles.summary: Reddit, Inc. announced it has filed a registration statement on Form S-1 with the U.S. SEC for a proposed initial public offering of its Class A common stock. The number of shares and price range are yet to be determined, though Reddit intends to list its Class A common stock on the NYSE under the ticker symbol “RDDT.” Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan, and BofA Securities are among the lead book-running managers for the offering.

articles.title: Capital One to acquire Discover for $35bn; top US banks face surge in bad property debt
articles.summary: Capital One is set to acquire Discover Financial Services in a $35.3bn all-stock deal, aiming to create the sixth-largest US bank by assets and a major credit card competitor. This merger is expected to face intense antitrust scrutiny, particularly given planned reforms to US bank merger regulations. Concurrently, US banks are grappling with a surge in problematic commercial property debt.

articles.title: Trump Triumph: 7 Stocks to Buy if Republicans Win the Election in 2024
articles.summary: This article identifies seven stocks that could benefit significantly if Republicans, particularly Donald Trump, win the 2024 presidential election. The author suggests that Trump's policies, such as a tough-on-crime stance, deregulation, and promotion of domestic energy production, would create tailwinds for companies in sectors like defense, oil and gas, banking, and traditional automotive manufacturing. The analysis includes companies like Axon Enterprise, Baker Hughes, JPMorgan Chase, Rumble, Borr Drilling, Seadrill, and Ford Motor.

articles.title: Capital One to acquire Discover Financial
articles.summary: Capital One announced its plan to acquire Discover Financial Services in an all-stock transaction valued at a 26.6% premium. The deal, expected to close in late 2024 or early 2025, aims to create a global payments platform with significant synergies. The acquisition will leverage Capital One's technology transformation and expand its presence in the financial services sector, while maintaining the Discover brand on its cards.

articles.title: Sempra Looking Beyond LNG Pause to ‘Development Milestones’ for Port Arthur, Cameron Expansions
articles.summary: Sempra Infrastructure is focusing on development milestones and partnerships for its LNG projects, including Port Arthur LNG and Cameron LNG expansions, despite the Biden administration's pause on new export authorizations. The company anticipates an FID for Cameron LNG's fourth train by July 2025 and expects to complete its Gasoducto Rosarito pipeline project in Mexico by year-end. Sempra reported increased full-year natural gas revenue for 2023 and outlined significant capital expenditures for infrastructure investments over the next five years.

articles.title: Episode #522: Wes Gray & Robert Elwood on How to Convert a Separately Managed Account (SMA) to an ETF
articles.summary: This podcast episode features Wes Gray and Robert Elwood discussing their experience in converting Separately Managed Accounts (SMAs) to Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) via Section 351, including a recent conversion of $770 million. They delve into the process, advantages, and challenges of such conversions, highlighting tax efficiencies and the broader implications for financial advisors and family offices. The discussion also touches upon the future of asset management and the rising trend of SMA to ETF conversions.

articles.title: Wall Street's Moelis bets big on Mid-East
articles.summary: Moelis & Co., a boutique investment bank, is significantly expanding its operations in the Middle East, driven by a frenzy of dealmaking, particularly IPOs, in the region. This strategic focus by Moelis, despite its comparatively smaller global revenue, highlights the firm's relationship-building efforts and willingness to navigate geopolitical complexities. The Middle East's robust deal environment stands in contrast to a dearth of business elsewhere, making it a crucial growth area for the firm.

articles.title: Sherwin-Williams among companies softening vocabulary following DEI backlash
articles.summary: Companies like Sherwin-Williams, Uber Technologies Inc., and Citigroup Inc. are softening their vocabulary around diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives in corporate filings, replacing terms like "anti-racist" with softer language such as "Belonging and Culture." This shift is a response to conservative backlash, the Supreme Court's affirmative action ruling, and increased scrutiny that has led to lawsuits and public campaigns against corporate DEI efforts. While the language changes, most companies report only a minimal decrease in actual DEI efforts, though many are becoming more cautious in their public statements to mitigate legal risks.

articles.title: Passive Gets Active: the Latest ETF Trend
articles.summary: Actively managed ETFs are gaining significant popularity globally, particularly in the US, and are starting to grow in Europe, offering investors a different approach to traditional passive funds. While they provide advantages like lower costs and transparency compared to mutual funds, experts note that current active ETFs may not offer the same full flexibility as traditional active funds due to constraints on tracking error and management costs. This trend is driven by market saturation in passive strategies and the recognition of ETFs as versatile investment vehicles.
